_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

 

1. Policies: Simplot AB Retail Sub, Inc. (Simplot) is committed to the prevention of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia and have a written accidental release prevention plan in place that will be implemented and followed by facility management and employees. In the event an accidental release requires emergency response, Simplot will not respond to the release and will coordinate with and rely on response to the release by local authorities. 



2. Source and Substance: As part of the operations at this facility, Simplot stores, transfers and distributes anhydrous ammonia to farmers for use as a crop production nutrient.  



4. Accidental Release Prevention Program: This facility will complete inspections, training, and mechanical integrity in accordance with the written prevention program. The program was written in accordance with 40 CFR part 68 and ANSI/CGA G-2.1-2014. All parts used in the process are compatible with anhydrous ammonia, routine inspections are conducted to identify mechanical integrity concerns and employees are trained on the safe handling of anhydrous ammonia as well as process operating procedures. 



5. Five Year Accident History: No accidental releases have occurred at this facility within the last five years that meet the requirements provided in ?68.42(a)



6. Emergency Response Program: Simplot has a written emergency action plan in accordance with OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.38 and provides state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III of EPCRA. Our emergency action plan has been reviewed with the local fire department and provided to the local emergency planning committee for coordination in the community response planning.



7. Planned Changes to Improve Safety: Simplot will periodically evaluate safety systems and release prevention components on the process systems. Industry best management practices (BMP) will be considered
for safety improvements as those BMPs prove to significantly increase the safety of the system. There are no planned changes for this system at this time.
